isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - BATTERY, CHARGING AND CRANKING SYSTEMS - DESCRIPTION - BATTERY POWER

svcprocinfo.para: There are three main functions of the storage battery:

item.para: To supply power to the starter and ignition system so the engine can be cranked and started.
To supply extra power required when the vehicle's load requirements exceed the supply from the charging system.
To act as a voltage stabilizer by smoothing out or reducing temporary high voltage within the electrical system.

svcsubproc.title: Remote Start Terminal
svcsubproc.para: An optional remote mounted start terminal allows an external battery power source to either charge the vehicle batteries or assist in cranking the engine.
